meanings.definition: A person acting as a substitute for a vicar.
meanings.sent1: The subvicar led the church service when the vicar was ill.
meanings.sent2: The subvicar was appointed to assist the vicar during busy times.
meanings.sent3: The subvicar accidentally wore the vicar's robe to the service, causing a mix-up.
meanings.sent4: In the absence of the vicar, the subvicar's presence brought a sense of calm to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The subvicar's dedication to the church made a lasting impression on the parishioners.

meanings.definition: To act as a subvicar in place of the vicar.
meanings.sent1: She had to subvicar for the vicar at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: He subvicared for the vicar during his vacation.
meanings.sent3: The young intern subvicaring for the vicar accidentally rang the church bells at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to subvicar effectively earned her the respect of the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility to subvicar fell on him unexpectedly, but he rose to the occasion.
